answers.answer: I'm 72 years old, diagnosed with stage 3 CHF, quit heavy smoking about 20 years ago, had weight issues, diabetes... I also have less than 30% of heart function.  That said, I'm still standing, and will work part time for 3 hours tomorrow and do 2 hours of volunteer work tomorrow.  I'm breathless a good deal of the time.That said, it sounds like your father is really struggling with blockages in his arteries that are difficult/impossible to clear.  Is a heart bypass possible?It sounds to me that you need to visit with the doctor and talk to you father about  his issues going forward.  Your dad may need a reason to continue, or there may be more going on than you learned.  Do what you can to keep your father comfortable and encouraged, and keep us informed.

question: My dad is 58 years old. He was just recently diagnosed with stage 3 CHF, he was a longterm smoker, battled weight issues off and on, high blood pressure, as well as diabetic which he normally controlled by diet when he felt like it. Just today, he had a heart cath done, and the cardiologist said that he is at 30% heart function, his main arteries fused together so they couldn't get through them, and he has significant heart damage which is unrepairable. He is already on meds, as well as wearing a vest defibrillator. They said his only chance is a heart transplant, but with his age and diabeties, he doesn't qualify. Someone please tell me what all this means? There is nothing they can do which is what was said? What is his life expectancy? I am 8 hours from him, so I was not there to ask questions and with all of the info given, I can't piece it altogether. PLEASE HELP.
title: Doctor explain...PLEASE
